definitions.definition: covering or affecting the whole world

examples.text: This year the **global economy** will grow by about 4 per cent.
the struggle to stay competitive in **global markets**
the country's ability to compete **on a global scale**
the global ban on commercial whaling
a global network of 64 national, regional and international organizations

definitions.definition: considering or including all parts of something

examples.text: We need to take a more global approach to the problem.
They sent a global email to all staff.

definitions.definition: operating or applying through the whole of a file, program, etc.

examples.text: We ran a global search on the database.
